info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 3:56AM MST until July 18 at 5:00AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 356 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inches of rain has fallen over the Mount Nutt Wilderness Area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in western Golden Valley. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western Golden Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
